articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Morning Joe 1/2/20
articles.description: Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Republican Strategist: I feel 'abandoned by my party'
articles.description: A bold new headline in the New York Times reads: “Republican women are in crisis.” Ayman Mohyeldin is joined by Republican Strategist Susan del Percio, author and historian Nancy Cohen, and All In Together co-founder Lauren Leader to discuss why 2020 might be…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Collins open to witnesses in impeachment trial
articles.description: Sen. Susan Collins, R-Maine, has become the second Republican to attack Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell for saying he is coordinating with the White House. The panel discusses.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Esper: U.S. could 'take preemptive action' if Iran prepares additional attacks
articles.description: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper warned that the United States had the capability to "take preemptive action" if Iran prepared further attacks against American bases or assets in the Middle East.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Thursday's Campaign Round-Up, 1.2.20
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content:
Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
* Former HUD Secretary Julian Castro, the only Latino candidate seeking the Democratic presidential nomination, ended his campaign this morning. There are still 14 candidates vying f… [+2440 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Author KK Ottesen talks new book 'Activist: Portraits of Courage'
articles.description: Dozens of activists who were photographed and profiled in the book, "Activist: Portraits of Courage."

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Notable passings from Charlie Brown producer to Yankees legend
articles.description: From TV producer Lee Mendelson and former NBA Commissioner David Stern to Yankees legend Don Larsen and musician Jack Sheldon, Morning Joe looks at notable passings from the end of 2019 and beginning of 2020.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Even Trump's handpicked scientists balk at his approach to science
articles.description: Team Trump thought it was stacking the EPA's Scientific Advisory Board with allies. Evidently, it didn't help.
articles.content: It wasn’t long after Donald Trump and his team took office that they looked for ways to make things easier for polluters. Among the first steps was overhauling the EPA’s Scientific Advisory Board: many scholars with academic backgrounds were out, scientists w… [+3243 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Gallagher: GOP senators 'in lockstep' with McConnell
articles.description: Congressman Mike Gallagher (R-WI) joins Geoff Bennett to discuss the pending Senate impeachment trial, arguing that the Senators on both sides of the aisle will not remain impartial because they are inherently partisan.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Spotlight returns to Trump's intense...
articles.description: The problem with Trump's golf habit isn't limited to hypocrisy. There's also the casual corruption to consider.
articles.content:
Trump gets back to 'work' at golf club resort 
On Christmas Eve, Donald Trump set aside about a half-hour for a video teleconference with military servicemembers, during which the president fielded an easy question: how would he spend his holiday? After plug… [+2276 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: NYT: Dems highlight different reality facing middle class despite strong market
articles.description: The markets ended 2019 strong, but that's not the case for many middle class Americans. Politico's Ben White and the New York Times' Jeremy Peters join Stephanie Ruhle to explain why the numbers the president loves to tout aren't telling the whole story.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Some ultra-wealthy argue for paying higher taxes
articles.description: The Patriotic Millionaires are a group trying to address income inequality and reverse the impact of trickle-down economies. Among them is Abigail Disney. The New Yorker's Sheelah Kolhatkar discusses.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Remembering former NBA commissioner David Stern
articles.description: NBA commissioner emeritus David Stern passed away on January 1st at the age of 77.  Fans and players alike remembered Stern and honored his legacy, which includes standing by Magic Johnson when the Hall of Famer announced he was HIV positive, expanding the NB…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Giuliani would 'love' to represent Trump at Senate impeachment trial
articles.description: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani says he'd be willing to testify at his client's Senate trial, but he would "love" to represent Trump in the proceedings. "I would testify, I would do demonstrations, I'd give lectures, I'd give summations…

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: New evidence suggests Trump's tariff...
articles.description: Trump embraced a tariff strategy to boost the U.S. manufacturing sector. The evidence suggests this backfired, hurting those the president intended to help.
articles.content: After Donald Trump advanced his trade war with a series of tariffs, the president expressed great confidence that his gambit was as effective as it was wise. The Republican spent months arguing that his policy was pumping billions of dollars into the treasury… [+2302 chars]
